org.prop4j.explain.solvers

Interface MusExtractor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    MutableSatSolver, SatProblem, SatSolver
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Ltms, Sat4jAllMusExtractor, Sat4jMusExtractor

    public interface MusExtractor
extends MutableSatSolver
    A solver capable of extracting a minimal unsatisfiable subset (MUS) from a propositional formula.
    Author:
    Timo Günther

    • Method Detail

      • getMinimalUnsatisfiableSubset

        java.util.Set<Node> getMinimalUnsatisfiableSubset()
                                           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException

        Returns any minimal unsatisfiable subset (MUS) of the problem. A MUS is any unsatisfiable subset of the formula which cannot be reduced any further without becoming satisfiable.

        A MUS can act as an explanation for why a formula is unsatisfiable. As such, the problem must be unsatisfiable for a MUS to be found.

        Returns:
        any minimal unsatisfiable subset; not null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the formula in this solver is satisfiable

      • getMinimalUnsatisfiableSubsetIndexes

        java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getMinimalUnsatisfiableSubsetIndexes()
                                                               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns any minimal unsatisfiable subset (MUS) of the problem. Each clause is referenced by its index instead of object.
        Returns:
        any minimal unsatisfiable subset; not null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the formula in this solver is satisfiable

      • getAllMinimalUnsatisfiableSubsets

        java.util.List<java.util.Set<Node>> getAllMinimalUnsatisfiableSubsets()
                                                               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns all minimal unsatisfiable subsets of the problem.
        Returns:
        all minimal unsatisfiable subsets of the problem
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the formula in this solver is satisfiable
